titleStmt.title: The compters common-wealth, or A voiage made to an infernall iland long since discouered by many captaines, seafaring-men, gentlemen, marchants, and other tradesmen but the conditions, natures, and qualities of the people there inhabiting, and of those that trafficke with them, were neuer so truly expressed or liuely set foorth as by William Fennor His Maiesties servant.
titleStmt.author: Fennor, William.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Edward Griffin for George Gibbes and are to be sold at his shoppe in Pauls Churchyard at the signe of the Floure-de-luce,

notesStmt.note: Describes his experience as a prisoner for debt.
The words "by William Fennor His Maiesties servant" are bracketed together on the title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shoppe in Pauls Churchyard at the signe of the Floure-de-luce
